title: 110_hr1407
content: The Act titled "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans. The "Higher Education Affordability and Equity Act of 2007" expands the deduction for interest on education loans by repealing the dollar limitation and increasing the phaseout beginning point based on modified adjusted gross income. The deduction for interest on education loans is reduced based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, with a minimum threshold. The deduction for interest on education loans is reduced based on the taxpayer's modified adjusted gross income, with a minimum threshold of $100,000 ($200,000 for joint returns). Modified adjusted gross income is calculated without considering specific sections and after applying certain adjustments. The deduction for interest on education loans is subject to income thresholds of $100,000 and $200,000 for joint returns, with adjustments made based on specific tax code sections and cost-of-living adjustments. The deduction for interest on education loans is subject to income thresholds and cost-of-living adjustments. The amendments made by this section will apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2007. SEC. 3 makes the deduction for qualified tuition and related expenses permanent by repealing subsection (e) of Section 222 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendment applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2007. SEC. 4 addresses education savings accounts. The amendment increases allowable contributions from $2,000 to $5,000 in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Reports must be filed by June 30 of the following year. Effective date for the amendments is specified. The amendments increase allowable contributions from $2,000 to $5,000 in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.
